cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENTPrinted for the War Cabinet. May 1940.SECRET. Copy No.W.M. (40)140th Conclusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 140 (40).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Sunday, May 26, 1940, at 2 p.m.Present :The Right Hon. Winston S. Churchill, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Neville Chamberlain,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Viscount Halifax,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P.,Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. A. Greenwood, M.P.,Minister without Portfolio.The following were also present:The Right Hon. A. V. Alexander,M.P., First Lord of the Admiralty.The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,Secretary of State for War.The Hon. Sir Alexander Cadogan,Permanent Under-Secretary of State,Foreign Office.Sir Edward Bridges (Secretary).[21341] WAR CABINET 140 (40).M. Reynaud'8 The Prime Minister gave his colleagues a short account of his visit. conversation with M. Reynaud as to the position in France.Later in the afternoon the Meeting was resumed at AdmiraltyHouse. (The Service Ministers were not present on this occasion.)A record of the discussion is contained in the Secretary'standard File of War Cabinet Conclusions.
